attributes.action: review the tax on all school uniform - both primary and secondary - and ensure it should be free from VAT as long as it carries a school badge or emblem
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Parents can save £200 million p.a. if the Government scrapped VAT on school uniforms.

The tax is unjust, especially as the Dept for Education & Skills began a campaign against overpriced school kit earlier this year.

The Government argues that uniforms stop brand wars & bullying, yet they tax secondary school uniform.

Parents pay the full 17.5% VAT on clothes for children aged 14+, including school uniform.

Children's clothes that are larger than certain sizes are taxed so that petite adults cannot avoid the duty.

The VAT cut-off points of 43in for chests & 28.5in for trousers are not reasonable.  The size limit should be scrapped & instead all uniform - both primary & secondary - should be free from VAT as long as it carries a school badge/emblem.

By ensuring that uniform carries a school badge/emblem petite adults would not be able to take advantage of the change in the law.

It would seem to me in terms of justice & logic that it would make clear sense for all school uniforms to be zero-rated.  

The VAT charge hits poorer parents hardest, making up a greater proportion of their spending.

Scrapping the VAT would save about £35 for every parent.
